timeline.bodyText: That's a really ugly band-aid. Have you checked the PR without it?
timeline.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText:
I have started 12 jenkins builds.

6 builds without the PR - 1 fails
6 builds with the PR - 0 fails

The issue happens because of the completion timeout - https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/CompletionHandler.java#L132
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
Are we waiting for the indexing to finish? Could we ensure it's done before running the completion tests?
Also the tests could control the timeout value with a system property
replies.author: fbricon

replies.bodyText:
Are we waiting for the indexing to finish?

Yes, we are. See https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.tests/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/managers/AbstractProjectsManagerBasedTest.java#L231

Also the tests could control the timeout value with a system property

The timeout value is hardcoded

https://github.com/eclipse/eclipse.jdt.ls/blob/master/org.eclipse.jdt.ls.core/src/org/eclipse/jdt/ls/core/internal/handlers/CompletionHandler.java#L132
10e0a06
replies.author: snjeza

replies.bodyText:
Yes so it needs to be changed to something like
private static long TIMEOUT  = Long.getLong("completion.timeout", 5000);
replies.author: fbricon

timeline.message:
